clinical_study.brief_title: Organizing the Information Given to Parents of NICU Infants in Order to Reduce Their Anxiety
clinical_study.official_title: Dose Organizing the Information Given to Parents of NICU Infants Reduce Their Anxiety?

brief_summary.textblock: Being a parent to a premature infant in NICU is an anxious state. Parents ask a lot of questions, and look for information all the time. Organizing the information given to parents could reduce their anxiety. The parents will be divided into two groups: one group will get organized information, by a lecture at the first week of their infant's life, and the other group will not. Of course, questions will be answered all the time. The parents will answer a questionnaire on the first week of the infant's life, and on the last week, just before releasing the infant home.

clinical_study.why_stopped: After a discussion, we decided to withdraw the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between questionnaires at the first week and the last week to hospitalization.

arm_group.description: The group that will have lecture of information regarding infants in NICU.
The group that will not have lecture of information regarding NICU hospitalization

intervention.description: Lecture of information regarding prematurity, NICU hospitalization, etc.

Inclusion Criteria:
- Parents to premature infants, after releasing the mother
Exclusion Criteria:
